subject: Marketing
title: The Jingle Era
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Jingle Era.

hook.text: You can sing the McDonald's jingle right now. You learned it decades ago without trying.

buildup.text: Jingles used melody to embed brand messages in memory. Music bypasses critical thinking.

discovery.text: A catchy tune creates an earwormâ€”involuntary recall that fires every time the melody surfaces.

twist.text: Jingles faded in the 2000s as brands chased 'cool.' Now sonic branding is bringing them back.

climax.text: Netflix's 'ta-dum' and Intel's five notes prove that sound logos still own mental real estate.

punchline.text: A melody sticks longer than any slogan.

quiz.question: Why are jingles so effective as advertising tools?
options: Music bypasses critical thinking and creates involuntary recall
Jingles are cheaper to produce than visual ads
Consumers actively seek out new jingles to listen to
